faq.ques: How much does a new roof installation typically cost?
faq.ans: Roofing costs depend on roof size, pitch, chosen materials, and any structural repairs. On average, residential roof replacements range widely, but We provide a free, detailed estimate after a roof inspection so you get an accurate price for your property in [city_name], [slug_id]. Call [phone] to schedule.

faq.ques: How long will my roof last?
faq.ans: Lifespan varies by material: architectural asphalt shingles often last 20–30 years, metal roofs 40+ years, and quality tile roofs can exceed 50 years with proper maintenance. We’ll help you choose materials based on longevity and budget.

faq.ques: Do you handle permits for roof replacement?
faq.ans: Yes. We handle permit applications and inspections required by local jurisdictions so your roof replacement is code-compliant and worry-free.

faq.ques: What should I do if I suspect a roof leak?
faq.ans: Call us for an emergency inspection. Quick action can minimize interior damage. We provide temporary tarping and prompt repairs to stop leaks and prevent further harm.

faq.ques: How often should I have my roof inspected?
faq.ans: We recommend a professional inspection at least once a year and after major storms. Regular inspections catch small issues early and can extend your roof’s life while avoiding costly repairs.

faq.ques: How long does a roof replacement usually take?
faq.ans: A typical residential roof replacement can take 1–3 days depending on size, material and weather. Larger or more complex projects may take longer. We provide a project timeline with your estimate so you know what to expect.
